A **frost giant**, H, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. The frost giant is a [giant humanoid](/wiki/Giant_humanoid "Giant humanoid") that has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision") and can be seen via infravision. Like all [giants](/wiki/Giant_\(monster_attribute\) "Giant (monster attribute)"), frost giants will seek out [gems](/wiki/Gems "Gems"), weapons and other items to pick up, and can move over [boulders](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder"), pick them up and throw them.

A frost giant has a single weapon attack, and possesses [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance").

[Eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") a frost giant [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") has a 1⁄3 chance (33%) of granting cold resistance, and an independent 1⁄2 chance (50%) of increasing a character's [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

The attacks of frost giants and other sufficiently large monsters can inflict knockback, sending targets flying one or more squares.

Frost giants and other large humanoids can wear mummy wrappings.

[ ]

## Contents

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Frost giants may generate as peaceful towards chaotic characters, and can generate in small [groups](/wiki/Groups "Groups") of two to four. They will not be randomly generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").

Frost giants may appear among the hostile giant humanoids generated in [throne rooms](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room") at dungeon levels 13 and below, and can also appear among the monsters randomly generated by [looting](/wiki/Looting "Looting") a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") and carrying gold (provided there is no [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest") on the level).[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Frost giants may appear among the random H that are part of the second quest monster class for [Cavepeople](/wiki/Cavepeople "Cavepeople"), and make up 6⁄175 (\~3.42%) of the monsters randomly generated on the [Caveman quest](/wiki/Caveman_quest "Caveman quest"). Frost giants may also appear among the random H that are part of the second quest monster class for [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie"), and make up 6⁄175 (\~3.42%) of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [Valkyrie quest](/wiki/Valkyrie_quest "Valkyrie quest").

Frost giants have a 1⁄2 chance (50%) of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") either a boulder or a [club](/wiki/Club "Club") with equal probability, and an independent chance of being generated with a small assortment of gems.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) They are eligible for [offensive items](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item"), [defensive items](/wiki/Defensive_item "Defensive item"), and [miscellaneous items](/wiki/Miscellaneous_item "Miscellaneous item").

## Strategy

Frost giants are slightly stronger than fire giants, with slightly more [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)"), and can generate with dangerous [wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand") and [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion") like other giants. Fortunately, most characters can deal with groups of through the same standard methods.

While frost giant meat is likely to grant intrinsic cold resistance, many characters will have obtained the intrinsic from other earlier sources such as [blue jellies](/wiki/Blue_jellies "Blue jellies") and [winter wolf cubs](/wiki/Winter_wolf_cub "Winter wolf cub"), though their corpses and tins will still be used to increase strength regardless.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Knockback can make frost giants and other large monsters exceedingly dangerous if the player character is positioned between them and a hazard, such as [pools](/wiki/Pool "Pool") of water or [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava").

## History

The frost giant first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), frost giants may appear among the random H generated in [giant courts](/wiki/Giant_court "Giant court") and the [Giant Caverns](/wiki/Giant_Caverns "Giant Caverns").

A peaceful frost giant named Goliath appears as an assistant in the [black market](/wiki/Black_market_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Black market (SLASH'EM)").

All of the above information also applies to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), frost giants can generate in [Sheol](/wiki/Sheol "Sheol").

A peaceful frost giant named Goliath appears as an assistant in the variant's [black market](/wiki/Black_market_\(UnNetHack\) "Black market (UnNetHack)").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), frost giants are neutral-aligned and vulnerable to [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and are capable of [swimming](/wiki/Swimming "Swimming"). They are always generated with a [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword"), [helmet](/wiki/Helmet "Helmet") and [scale mail](/wiki/Scale_mail "Scale mail") made to fit their size - this is independent of the existing chance of being generated with a club, due to an oversight in the code.

Frost giants may appear among the court of a [titan](/wiki/Titan "Titan")-ruled [throne room](/wiki/Throne_room#dNetHack "Throne room").

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), a peaceful frost giant named Goliath appears as an assistant in the variant's [black market](/wiki/Black_market_\(SpliceHack\) "Black market (SpliceHack)").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), frost giants are capable of entering [berserker rages](/wiki/Berserk_\(EvilHack\) "Berserk (EvilHack)"), increasing their damage but making them more likely to hit monsters around them besides their intended target.

Frost giants are among the monsters randomly generated in the [Ice Queen's Realm](/wiki/Ice_Queen%27s_Realm "Ice Queen's Realm"): each floor below the top floor generates a frost giant at level creation, and several frost giants may occupy the [treasure zoos](/wiki/Treasure_zoo "Treasure zoo") inside [Kathryn the Ice Queen](/wiki/Kathryn_the_Ice_Queen "Kathryn the Ice Queen")'s castle.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, frost giants can go berserk as in EvilHack.

## Encyclopedia entry

Giants have always walked the earth, though they are rare in these times. They range in size from little over nine feet to a towering twenty feet or more. The larger ones use huge boulders as weapons, hurling them over large distances. All types of giants share a love for men - roasted, boiled, or fried. Their table manners are legendary.

## References
